attributes.action: impose a 100% tax rate on all and any recent bonuses paid to M.O.D. staff.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
£47,283,853 has been paid as bonuses for 'Outstanding Performance' to M.O.D. staff in the last 7 months.

47 million pounds for what?

Outstanding performance, obviously.

A shortage of heavy-lift helicopters.

Soft-skinned Land Rovers still being used on the roads, and at least one instance of troops having to hire a vehicle locally.

A shortage of ECM, (Electronic Counter Measures), equipment to help counter roadside bombs.

Aircraft with little or no fire suppression systems.

Shortage of body armour.

Shortage of communications equipment.

8 Chinook helicopters purchased in 2001 still awaiting flight software.

We could easily go on ...

Outstanding Performance?

We don't think so and we want the money back and for it to be spent addressing some of the serious problems our troops have to face as a consequence of this 'Outstanding Performance'.
